This will break any client that was using `/resourcequota?watch=true&fieldSelector=name=foo`
cc @bgrant0607 .
Yeah, can't remove support for "name". Must support both.
Add a comment to "name" that it was a bug, but must be supported by the v1 API.

Actually I dont see any field label conversion funcs defined for ResourceQuotas: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/api/v1/conversion.go#L41.
Indeed `api/v1/watch/namespaces/default/resourcequotas?fieldSelector=name=foo` returns:

```
{
  "kind": "Status",
  "apiVersion": "v1",
  "metadata": {},
  "status": "Failure",
  "message": "No field label conversion function found for version v1 and kind ResourceQuota",
  "reason": "BadRequest",
  "code": 400
}
```

So this change will not break any external client using the REST API. This will still, however, break internal code that is directly calling storage.Watch(labels.Everything, fields.AsSelector(fields.Set{"name":"foo"})).
I guess, we should be fine as long as all our tests pass.
I've added it back with a comment.
As per my comment, I dont think we need to support name (external clients could not have used it anyway). Will discuss it with @bgrant0607 tomorrow. Not blocking this PR on that.
Discussed this with @bgrant0607 and sent https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/13457 to delete that
